articles.description: Follow live text, in-play video clips and radio commentary as New Zealand play Sri Lanka in the Men's Cricket World Cup 2023.
articles.title: World Cup: New Zealand v Sri Lanka - clips, radio & text

articles.description: Champions League reaction as Man Utd lose 4-3 at FC Copenhagen after Marcus Rashford red card, while Arsenal beat Sevilla.
articles.title: Reaction after Man Utd's chaotic defeat & Arsenal victory

articles.description: Seven goals, two penalties and a "game-changing" red card - VAR dominates again as Manchester United lose in Copenhagen.
articles.title: VAR 'out of control' in Man Utd's Copenhagen defeat

articles.description: Gary Lineker, Alan Shearer and Micah Richards discuss one of Olivier Giroud's best assists as they question whether the striker deserves more credit.
articles.title: 'The player everyone underrates' - Lineker on Giroud

articles.description: Claressa Shields grew up without support, protection or a bed to call her own. She has since scaled the heights to bring joy to Flint, a city that has become a byword for a broken American dream.
articles.title: 'Don't mess with Claressa' - a fighter as hard as Flint

articles.description: The Football Association doubles the Women's FA Cup prize fund in a "positive step" towards equal prize money.
articles.title: Women's FA Cup prize fund to be doubled to £6m

articles.description: New Zealand bowler Trent Boult takes the wickets of both Kusal Mendis and Sadeera Samarawickrama in the same over as his side take on Sri Lanka in the Cricket World Cup.
articles.title: Boult picks up two Sri Lanka wickets in same over

articles.description: Lionesses manager Sarina Wiegman believes it is "a matter of time" before a female manager takes charge of a professional men's team in England.
articles.title: Female boss in men's game 'a matter of time' - Wiegman

articles.description: Leandro Trossard and Bukayo Saka score as Arsenal claim a comfortable victory over lacklustre Sevilla in their Champions League Group B tie at Emirates Stadium.
articles.title: Trossard and Saka lead Arsenal to easy Sevilla win

articles.description: Harry Kane scores twice as Bayern Munich beat Galatasaray to reach the last 16 of the Champions League.
articles.title: Kane hits double as Bayern reach last 16
